URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13096

   It's for becoming compliant with the GDPR (the European Union's
   General Data Protection Regulation).
   
   See also:
   
     * https://privacy.apache.org/policies/privacy-policy-public.html
     * https://privacy.apache.org/faq/committers.html

kou commented on PR #13096:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13096#issuecomment-1121511552

   > I have grep the code for any other reference to the GA id (`UA-107500873-1`) and have not found any others
   
   We can also confirm it against the generated document that is uploaded to https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tag/actions-2038-azure-test-ubuntu-default-docs
   (I've confirmed that Google Analytics related tags aren't included.)
    
   > @kou only so I know how can I check that in the future, where did you found that the apache arrow site id is the id number 20?
   
   I asked it at `privacy@apache.org`: https://lists.apache.org/thread/g1cc82o4yv628c9652xsz7zwgy6vhl1p
   Note: This is a private mailing list that can be viewable only by committers.
   
   See also: https://privacy.apache.org/faq/committers.html#can-i-use-web-analytics-matomo
   
   > Can I use Web Analytics (Matomo)?
   >
   > Yes: the Privacy Comittee has established a VM running Matomo, a GDPR compliant web analytics software. You can ask for your site id and tracking code at privacy@apache.org
   
   
   BTW, we can see Matomo's dashboard for Apache Arrow at https://analytics.apache.org/index.php?module=CoreHome&action=index&date=yesterday&period=day&idSite=20#?period=day&date=yesterday&category=Dashboard_Dashboard&subcategory=1 .
